Bangladesh is tightening domestic measures from Jan. 13 to curb the spread of COVID-19. Officials will mandate facemasks at all public places; public gatherings are banned. There are more restrictions in place for partially or unvaccinated individuals - only fully vaccinated individuals may avail of dine-in facilities and hotel stays.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220124214757/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights-intelligence/intelligence/risk-alerts/wip10011894666/bangladesh-authorities-to-tighten-domestic-covid-19-curbs-from-jan-13-update-65

Commercial, educational, recreational, and most public venues are open with social distancing protocols. Public transport can operate at full capacity but with a curtailed schedule. Officials may further tighten measures in case of increased disease activity; curbs on nonessential businesses are possible.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220124214757/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights-intelligence/intelligence/risk-alerts/wip10011894666/bangladesh-authorities-to-tighten-domestic-covid-19-curbs-from-jan-13-update-65

All incoming travelers must carry negative results of a PCR test taken within 48 hours prior to departure. https://archive.vn/vTndr  "Delhi Schools Closed After Yellow Alert  Delhi government shuts schools, colleges and other educational institutions until further orders"  "Odisha: Primary Classes To Resume In January  The Odisha government Tuesday announced that physical classes will resume for students of classes 1 to 5 from January 3 . The announcement was made by School and Mass Education Minister S R Dash a few hours after Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik directed officials to make preparations on war-footing to deal with a possible third wave of COVID-19 in the state. (PTI)|"  "West Bengal Schools, Colleges May Be Closed  West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday asked officials to review the overall COVID-19 situation in the state. Ms Banerjee, during an administrative review meeting at Sagar Island, also said that schools and colleges might be shut down for some time if the situation so demands.   "COVID-19 cases are on the rise... there are a few Omicron cases also. So, review the situation in the state. We may consider closing down schools and colleges for some time," the minister told officials at the meeting. (PTI)"

Please US embassy link last updated 04/10/21  https://web.archive.org/web/20211115064301/https://np.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/     Effective September 24, all fully vaccinated foreigners arriving in Nepal via the immigration office at the airport or a land border can receive on-arrival visas. No quarantine required. Fully-vaccinated travellers travelling to Nepal must present the following documents:  1.Evidence of completion of a 14 day post-COVID-19 vaccination incubation period  2.COVID-19 negative PCR test report obtained within 72 hours of entry into Nepal    On-arrival visas at land border entries are not available to unvaccinated travelers. All unvaccinated and semi-vaccinated travelers must comply with the Government of Nepalâs 10-day quarantine mandate, which requires quarantine at a local hotel at their own cost. A PCR test must be completed and returned negative on 11th day before travelling within the country will be permitted. Such travelers must present the following documents:  1.COVID-19 negative PCR test report obtained within 72 hours of entering the country

As of January,05,2022, the Pakistani government has modified its international travel rules. Categorical classification of countries is no longer valid, effectively lifting travel bans from category C locations, including several African and European countries, and Hong Kong among others. Revised rules mandate inbound passengers to hold proof of completing vaccination if above 18 years old and negative results of a PCR test obtained within 48 hours before departure if older than six years. They must continue to submit a health declaration from online or via the Pass Track mobile application within 48 hours before arrival. Returning Pakistani citizens unable to avail of vaccination due to visa or medical issues, as well as Afghan citizens entering via land borders, are exempt from carrying vaccination certificate. Passengers arriving via direct flights from Europe will undergo an on arrival rapid antigen test (RAT); officials will also administer RAT to 50% of arrivals from Qatar, Saudi Arabia, the UAE, as well as a random selection of passengers from other countries. Passengers with positive RAT test results must quarantine for 10 days at a government or self-paid facility, those who test positive on the mandatory PCR test on the eighth day must undergo additional quarantine until they return negative result in a PCR test. Source: Garda World  Archived link: https://web.archive.org/web/20220109175054/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/562991/pakistan-authorities-lift-travel-bans-modify-entry-testing-restrictions-as-of-jan-5-update-64

All citizen 12+ years old are eligible to receive COVID-19 vaccines. For boosters shot eligibility criteria as follows:  1.	Immunocompromised persons of all eligible age groups  2.	Citizen, 30 years of age and above  3.	Healthcare workers.  For age group 12-18 years old only Pfizer vaccine is administered.   Available vaccines are Sinopharm, Sinovac, Pfizer and Moderna.   Vaccine is free for unvaccinated.  Source: Government of Pakistan National Command Operating Centre  Archived link: https://web.archive.org/web/20220110155852/https://ncoc.gov.pk/covid-vaccination-en.php
